smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the file contain visible elements and are not empty.
All use cases in the diagrams (e.g., 'Tuvasta kasutaja', 'Vaata aktiivseid peoruume') are connected to at least one actor (e.g., 'Klient', 'Peoruumide haldur').
No redundant use cases with synonymous names describing the same activity for the same actor were found.
No packages were found containing multiple elements with the exact same name.
No redundant data copies were found in the database models that are not handled by Foreign Key relationships (e.g., 'riik_kood' is properly linked via FK).
Use case naming is consistent, using the 'Verb + Noun' format (e.g., 'Registreeri peoruum', 'Vaata aktiivseid peoruume').
All states in the State Diagram (Page 10) are reachable from the start state or other valid states.
All actions in the Activity Diagrams (Pages 3 and 4) are reachable via the defined decision paths.
Class diagrams include multiplicity indicators (e.g., '0..*', '1'), and database diagrams use standard notation (crow's feet/lines) to imply multiplicity.
The Use Case diagram on Page 2 contains 11 central use case elements (ovals), which exceeds the threshold of 10.
No single class or table was found with 6 or more distinct visual connection lines on a single diagram page (e.g., 'Isik' on Page 12 has 5).

On Page 16 (Tootajate register DM), the distance between the related tables 'Tootaja' and 'Tootaja_rolli_omamine' spans the entire width of the diagram. This distance is significantly more than twice the average distance of other related elements (e.g., 'Tootaja'-'Isik' or 'Tootaja_rolli_omamine'-'Tootaja_roll'), which are placed in close proximity.
All use cases and activity actions start with an active verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
No classes, tables, attributes, or use cases were found with names 3 characters or shorter (e.g., 'Isik' and 'Riik' are 4 characters).
Class names obey the convention: they start with an uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Peoruum').
Attribute and column names start with a lowercase letter (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'reg_aeg').
No Hungarian notation or type prefixes (e.g., 'tbl_', 'str') were found in element names.
